subject: Re: [junit] Customizing JUnit HTML Report
msgSnippet: Hi Balaji, The ANT JUnit task does write everything you output to the TEST*.xml files. So you could measure the Oracle Time in your tests, and write it to
messageBody:
Hi Balaji,

The ANT JUnit task does write everything you output to the TEST*.xml files.
So you could measure the Oracle Time in your tests, and write it to System.out.

At that time it is available in the XML files, but the JUnitReport task does not write the log info to the HTML file.
You will have to customize the stylesheets that ANT uses to convert XML to HTML.

I have done this before, but to generate PDF with logs in stead of HTML: http://junitpdfreport.sourceforge.net/managedcontent/

You can have a look at the stylesheet on how to retrieve and render the System.out logs:
http://junitpdfreport.cvs.sourceforge.net/junitpdfreport/src/resources/report/themes/default/junit-noframes.xsl?view=markup

Regards, Jan



 



----- Original Message ----
From: balajiora <balajiora@...>
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, 10 September, 2008 19:40:01
Subject: [junit] Customizing JUnit HTML Report


Hi,

In my project currently I am using JUnit to generate the HTML Test Case
Report. In the HTML Report under the Method Details Section, Currently
its displaying the method name, status, type and Time (Execution time
of each method - Test Case).

My customer wants few modification in the HTML Report. In my test case
method, I am connecting to Oracle DB and executing a procedure. I am
logging the procedure execution time in log file. But customer wants
to see the execution time in JUnit HTML Report. Like Method Name,
Status, Oracle Execution Time, Test Case Time.

Could you please suggest me, What I can do to meet this expectation?
Waiting for your reply.

Regards
Balaji S






[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
